pr_title: Fix VertexIDAssigner bug when ids-flush is disabled

timeline.body: Could you use the assert from Junit5 instead of Junit4
timeline.bodyText: Could you use the assert from Junit5 instead of Junit4
timeline.bodyHTML: Could you use the assert from Junit5 instead of Junit4
timeline.author: farodin91

timeline.message:
Fix VertexIDAssigner bug when ids-flush is disabled

When ids-flush is disabled, ids are re-assigned even if elements
already have ids, e.g. update of existing elements. This commit
fixes this bug and does not re-assign ids.

Signed-off-by: Boxuan Li <liboxuan@connect.hku.hk>

Fix VertexIDAssigner bug when ids-flush is disabled

fixes this bug and does not re-assign ids.

Signed-off-by: Boxuan Li <liboxuan@connect.hku.hk>

Fix VertexIDAssigner bug when ids-flush is disabled

When ids-flush is disabled, ids are re-assigned even if elements
already have ids, e.g. update of existing elements. This commit
fixes this bug and does not re-assign ids.

Signed-off-by: Boxuan Li <liboxuan@connect.hku.hk>

Fix VertexIDAssigner bug when ids-flush is disabled

When ids-flush is disabled, ids are re-assigned even if elements
already have ids, e.g. update of existing elements. This commit
fixes this bug and does not re-assign ids.

Signed-off-by: Boxuan Li <liboxuan@connect.hku.hk>

timeline.body:
Adding some explanation:
https://github.com/JanusGraph/janusgraph/blob/8b2dd99b5dc4a9d4b29be168769aacd059d8a12e/janusgraph-core/src/main/java/org/janusgraph/graphdb/database/StandardJanusGraph.java#L674-L685

When `hasAssignIDsImmediately` is disabled, `idAssigner::assignIDs` is called, which in turn (skipping a few function calls within `VertexIDAssigner`) calls this `assignId` method.

If the given `element` is an existing element, e.g. an existing edge, then this `Preconditions.checkArgument(!element.hasId())` will fail. Thus, we should not throw an exception here. Moreover, we should `return` immediately, as we do not want to assign a new ID to it.
timeline.bodyHTML:
Adding some explanation:

janusgraph/janusgraph-core/src/main/java/org/janusgraph/graphdb/database/StandardJanusGraph.java

Lines 674 to 685 in 8b2dd99

public void commit(final Collection<InternalRelation> addedRelations,
final Collection<InternalRelation> deletedRelations, final StandardJanusGraphTx tx) {
if (addedRelations.isEmpty() && deletedRelations.isEmpty()) return;
//1. Finalize transaction
log.debug("Saving transaction. Added {}, removed {}", addedRelations.size(), deletedRelations.size());
if (!tx.getConfiguration().hasCommitTime()) tx.getConfiguration().setCommitTime(times.getTime());
final Instant txTimestamp = tx.getConfiguration().getCommitTime();
final long transactionId = txCounter.incrementAndGet();
//2. Assign JanusGraphVertex IDs
if (!tx.getConfiguration().hasAssignIDsImmediately())
idAssigner.assignIDs(addedRelations);

When hasAssignIDsImmediately is disabled, idAssigner::assignIDs is called, which in turn (skipping a few function calls within VertexIDAssigner) calls this assignId method.

If the given element is an existing element, e.g. an existing edge, then this Preconditions.checkArgument(!element.hasId()) will fail. Thus, we should not throw an exception here. Moreover, we should return immediately, as we do not want to assign a new ID to it.
timeline.author: li-boxuan
